intro: Nunnezharia alternans, commonly known as the alternate leaf fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its alternate arrangement of leaves along the stem. The plant features slender, creeping stems that produce small, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are typically small and inconspicuous, often clustered in spikes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
